column5: Learn how to harness recent unprecedented advances in genomic technologies to improve patient outcomes on this master's in genomics. You’ll gain experience of exploring and applying data gained through sampling, sequencing and interpreting genomic information in both clinical and academic research.We look at Genomics in the context of its application to clinical practice and to medical and academic research. This MSc in genomics is, therefore, suitable for health professionals from different professional backgrounds, including medicine, nursing, public health, science and technology.You’ll be able to tailor your learning to your professional needs.Your genomics pathway options are:
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 1 Year Full Time / 2 Years Part Time
